item.title: World Briefing: Mali: Rebels Say They Have Captured 19 Soldiers
item.description: A rebel coalition said that it was holding soldiers captured in fighting a day earlier, as growing violence in the north threatened to derail peace efforts brokered by the United Nations.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: India: Heat Wave Kills More Than 200 Since April
item.description: Daytime temperatures in Telangana soared to more than 118 degrees Fahrenheit on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Kenya: Thousands Attend Italian Nunâ€™s Beatification
item.description: Sister Irene Stefani arrived in Kenya in 1915, where she served as a Red Cross nurse and treated East African soldiers wounded during World War I.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Japan: Climate Change Aid Pledged for Pacific Islands
item.description: Japan pledged $450 million in aid to island nations that are battling rising sea levels and natural calamities as a result of global warming.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: China: Death Toll From Flooding Rises to at Least 57
item.description: At least 13 other people are missing in floods that have ravaged the mountain districts of six provinces and regions in central and southeastern China.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | United Nations: Emergency Fund Created for World Health Agency
item.description: Diplomats approved the creation of a $100 million fund to help the World Health Organization respond rapidly to emergencies.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Burundi Opposition Leader Is Killed
item.description: Gunmen shot Zedi Feruzi and his bodyguard in the capital on Saturday. Mr. Feruzi and others have said the presidentâ€™s plan to run for a third term is unconstitutional.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Saudis Say ISIS Ordered Suicide Bombing of Mosque
item.description: The suicide bombing on Friday killed at least 21 worshipers at a Shiite mosque in a town near Qatif, in the Eastern Province.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: Ethiopiaâ€™s Ruling Party Is Expected to Remain in Power
item.description: The Ethiopian Peopleâ€™s Revolutionary Democratic Front has been in power for 24 years. Given its influence in rural areas, it is likely to win again in Sundayâ€™s national election.
item.dc:creator: JACEY FORTIN
item.media:description: Voters in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, reading newspapers ahead of Sundayâ€™s election. The Ethiopian Peopleâ€™s Revolutionary Democratic Front, which currently governs, is expected to win.

item.title: With Victories, ISIS Dispels Hope of a Swift Decline
item.description: In its conquest of Ramadi and new control of Palmyra, the Islamic State has shown how dedication to its core principles helped it regain traction.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO and ANNE BARNARD

item.title: Republican Rivals Skirt Specifics on Plans to Fight ISIS
item.description: A picture has emerged of a field of declared and likely candidates that sound hawkish about fighting the Islamic State, yet are reluctant and even evasive when it comes to laying out detailed plans.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: PATRICK HEALY and ASHLEY PARKER
item.media:description: Among the Republican presidential hopefuls, Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina has offered the most detailed ideas about how to fight the Islamic State.

item.title: 3 Decades After Hate Crime, Irelandâ€™s Gay Population Hails Vote
item.description: The killing of a gay man that produced a movement also led to a distinction for Ireland: It is the only country to legalize same-sex marriage by popular vote.
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
item.dc:creator: DOUGLAS DALBY

item.title: Indian Minister Is Back
item.description: One of Indiaâ€™s most powerful politicians, Jayalalithaa Jayaram, was sworn in as chief minister of the southern state of Tamil Nadu on Saturday after a court overturned her conviction in a corruption case.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Egyptian Court Acquits 17 in Case Arising From Poetâ€™s Death at March
item.description: The charges and unexpected acquittals underscored the increasingly capricious nature of Egyptâ€™s justice system under its military-backed government.
item.dc:creator: MERNA THOMAS and KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Pakistani Journalists Resign to Cut Ties to Axact, a Fake Diploma Company
item.description: The defections came hours after the interior minister said that a preliminary investigation conducted last week had uncovered evidence against Axact.
item.dc:creator: SABA IMTIAZ

item.title: Q. & A.: Our Man in Tehran Answers Your Questions About Iran
item.description: Thomas Erdbrink, the Tehran bureau chief for The New York Times, is posting his answers to readersâ€™ questions.
item.dc:creator: THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: Salvadorans Flock to Honor Beloved Archbishop on Path to Sainthood
item.description: People crowded the streets in San Salvador for a ceremony to beatify Archbishop Ã“scar Romero, who was assassinated in 1980 as the country lurched toward civil war.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETH MALKIN
item.media:credit: Meridith Kohut for The New York Times
item.media:description: Catholic pilgrims camped out in the rain early Saturday in the plaza in San Salvador.

item.title: Spainâ€™s Many Indicted Politicians Undercut â€˜Red Lineâ€™ Against Graft
item.description: Across the Valencia, region, about 50 indicted politicians are hoping to win re-election on Sunday, even as they prepare to appear before courts.
item.dc:creator: RAPHAEL MINDER
item.media:description: Pablo Iglesias of the leftist Podemos Party, campaigning ahead of elections in Spain on Sunday. The governing Popular Party failed in its pledge not to field any candidates facing indictments.

item.title: Ireland Votes to Approve Gay Marriage, Putting Country in Vanguard
item.description: Not long ago, the vote would have been unthinkable. Ireland decriminalized homosexuality only in 1993. But the vote was 62 percent in favor, with 38 percent opposed.
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
item.dc:creator: DANNY HAKIM and DOUGLAS DALBY
item.media:description: Supporters celebrated a historic vote to legalize same-sex marriage on Saturday in Dublin.
